intro: Ecbolium brachystachyum, commonly known as the short-stalked ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
